We support the banking sector in Azerbaijan.

Our programme to strengthen the local financial system and foster lending to small firms has been successfully completed.

Congratulations to participating financial institutions: Bank Respublika, Unibank, TuranBank OJSC and Muganbank OJSC.

Originally designed in response to the 2015 crisis aftermath, the Covid-19 outbreak made this intervention even more demanded and relevant.

Together with #EBRDdonors: EU Neighborhood & Enlargement and Turkey.

text:
I am proud to announce that in 2025, PASHA Bank OJSC was honored with the "Best Bank in Azerbaijan" award by the International Investor Magazine. This prestigious award is a result of our contributions to the development of the non-oil sector and the sustainable progress of the country's economy. By the end of 2024, our non-oil sector portfolio reached 3.015 billion AZN, with the SME portfolio growing by 19%. Our assets rose to 8.2 billion AZN, and our net profit reached 210.5 million AZN. We also made significant strides in financing green projects, concluding a syndicated loan agreement, and supporting #COP29 initiatives. By offering services tailored to our clients' needs, we support their success, making us a trusted partner. This award reflects not only the trust international experts place in us, but also the dedication and perseverance of our entire team. Our focus on delivering sustainable business solutions, strengthening our financial position in both local and regional markets, and supporting the non-oil sector is central to this success. I am confident that our continued focus on innovation and excellence will contribute even more to Azerbaijan‚Äôs economy, particularly in creating long-term value and positive change in the financial sector.

We have successfully concluded Kapital Bank's inaugural deal roadshow for our syndicated loan. This is a key step in securing our access to international capital markets. ü§ù 

Organized by Mashreq Bank, our tour to the key financial hubs of the Gulf region, Doha and Dubai, aimed to present our financial resilience and growth strategy to international financial institutions and discuss a $50 million syndicated facility.

This initiative marks a significant milestone not only for our bank but for Azerbaijan's financial sector as a whole. As a key company within the Bir ecosystem, we aim to further strengthen our international partnerships and continue our active contribution to projects that drive the national economy.

text:
How do you take feedback?

It‚Äôs not always easy. Sometimes the first thought is:
‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt see the full picture. They don‚Äôt know all the details.‚Äù

But what I think is that even the feedback that seems "unfair" has at least a small part of it worth paying attention to. Even if you don‚Äôt fully agree, there‚Äôs usually something you can take away from that.

Whenever you receive feedback, try to pause and ask yourself: ‚ÄúWhat part of this might be true? What can I learn or improve from this‚Äù

It‚Äôs not about blindly accepting everything people say. It‚Äôs about finding those small insights that help you grow.

Because in the long run, even small change is enough to push you forward.

text:
A few weeks ago, during a coaching session, my coach said to me:
"Wherever you go, they will be happy to have you."

At first, I took it as encouragement because I heard it as ‚ÄúYou're doing well.‚Äù
But the more I thought about that phrase, the more it made me reflect that this wasn‚Äôt just a compliment ‚Äî it was a reminder.

We often judge ourselves by the results we deliver, but people also notice the way you think, the way you guide, and the way you react when things get hard. Sometimes, that alone is one of the biggest parts of the value you bring.

So here‚Äôs the question: Do you walk in knowing you already bring value - or trying to prove that you do?

Maybe someone else needs this reminder too:
Wherever you go ‚Äî they will be happy to have you. Don‚Äôt forget that.

In September 2025, the Azerbaijani financial sector continued its dynamic growth trajectory, supported by a strengthening banking sector, rising digital payments, and a balanced monetary policy.
The non-oil sector remains the main driver of economic expansion, demonstrating steady growth trends throughout the year.
‚Ä¢ Total bank assets reached AZN 56.1 billion, while liabilities stood at AZN 49.0 billion.

‚Ä¢ The total loan portfolio grew by 2%, reaching AZN 29.3 billion.
‚Ä¢ Business loans: 53.1%
‚Ä¢ Consumer loans: 31.4%
‚Ä¢ Mortgage loans: 15.5%

‚Ä¢ National currency deposits dominate ‚Äî 67.7% of individual deposits are held in AZN.
‚Ä¢ In the first nine months of 2025, banks earned a net profit of AZN 910.7 million and paid AZN 214.5 million in profit tax.
‚Ä¢ Money supply (M2) increased by 1.5% compared to the beginning of the year, reaching AZN 37.2 billion, indicating stable liquidity conditions.
‚Ä¢ The number of payment cards reached 21.4 million, showing a 13% annual growth.
‚Ä¢ Domestic cashless transactions increased by 24% to AZN 8.9 billion.
‚Ä¢ E-commerce accounted for 88% of these transactions.
‚Ä¢ The number of POS terminals grew by 56.5%, and ATMs increased by 8.8%.

text:

Az…ôrbaycan iqtisadiyyatƒ± qlobal qeyri-sabitlik fonunda dayanƒ±qlƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± qoruyur. Qeyri-neft sektorunun rolu, islahat y√∂n√ºml√º fiskal idar…ôetm…ô v…ô sabit makroiqtisadi m√ºhit √∂lk…ônin uzunm√ºdd…ôtli inki≈üaf perspektivl…ôrini g√ºcl…ôndirir.

Eng:
According to the latest World Economic Outlook by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), Azerbaijan‚Äôs economy is expected to grow by 3.0% in 2025 and 2.5% in 2026. Expansion in the non-oil sector, government investments, and continuity in fiscal policy will support this growth.
Inflation is projected at 4.9% in 2024, 5.7% in 2025, and 4.5% in 2026 (according to IMF).
The current account balance will remain positive, around 4.3% of GDP.
Unemployment is expected to remain stable at approximately 5.3%.
According to the IMF, the fiscal policy implemented from 2025 regulates the spending of oil revenues and strengthens the sustainability of the state budget. The goal is to reinforce fiscal discipline and gradually reduce dependency on oil revenues.

Conclusion:
Azerbaijan maintains resilience amid global instability. The role of the non-oil sector, reform-oriented fiscal management, and a stable macroeconomic environment strengthen the country‚Äôs long-term development prospects.

text:
Counting days to the #IAC2023, we are excited to share that Rashad Nabiyev, the Minister of Digital Development and Transport of the Republic of Azerbaijan, had a meeting with Elon Musk, the founder of Tesla and SpaceX.

At the meeting that took place at Tesla's Giga Texas factory in Austin, they discussed the further cooperation between SpaceX and Azercosmos in the field of space technologies and satellite communications, provision of Starlink satellite internet in Azerbaijan, and launch of new satellites into the orbit, as well as touched upon the ongoing preparations for the 74th International Astronautical Congress in Baku.

resharedPost.text:
Data governance is often dismissed as red tape.
 In reality, it‚Äôs the backbone of trust, speed, and better decisions.

What people think it is:
 ‚Üí Restricting access to data
 ‚Üí Slowing projects with rules
 ‚Üí Complicated policies no one reads

What it‚Äôs actually about:
 ‚Üí Making data accessible and usable (not buried in systems only one person understands)
 ‚Üí Building trust in data quality (so your dashboards stop arguing)
 ‚Üí Protecting sensitive information without drowning in jargon
 ‚Üí Creating shared definitions (‚Äúcustomer‚Äù means the same thing everywhere)
 ‚Üí Balancing compliance with delivery (rules and results)
 ‚Üí Enabling faster, more confident decisions (‚Äúwhich number is right?‚Äù solved)
 ‚Üí Turning policies into real outcomes (less paperwork, more wins)

This year‚Äôs Tech Week in San Francisco was truly unforgettable! üöÄ 

As the regional organiser and partner of the Startup World Cup -a competition held in 100+ countries, bringing together winners, partners, and investors -we had the honour of participating in the semi-final and final stages this year.
Together with our regional winner, Kamran Eyubov, the CTO of Clopos, being a part of the Pegasus Tech Ventures family in San Francisco and connecting with hundreds of innovative ideas and an international investment network was an incredible experience. üåç

Just like last year, the regional final held in Azerbaijan was once again highlighted on the grand finale stage by Pegasus Tech Ventures partners. 

I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to Anis Uzzaman Ph.D., President of Pegasus Tech Ventures, his partner Bill Reichert, and the entire team for creating this opportunity. üôè
And yes, Anis -we‚Äôve got your word -next year, Pegasus Tech Ventures partners will come to Baku for the regional final to be held in Azerbaijan! üëè  

I would also like to thank all the speakers, guests, and startups who participated in this magnificent event.

It was even more inspiring for me to see the powerful talks and strengths of the women at this event ‚Äî thank you so much, ladies! Lori Greiner, Jessican Jensen, Michelle Zatlyn, Cynthia (Cindy) Stoddard, Camilla Matias, Claudine Emeott 

Supporting local and regional startups in gaining international recognition, growing, and accessing global opportunities is one of the most valuable missions for me. üëè

At PASHA Bank OJSC, safeguarding our cultural heritage and passing it on to future generations is a strategic priority.

In collaboration with the Azerbaijan State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre, Uzeyir Hajibeyli‚Äôs masterpiece ‚Äî the opera ‚ÄúKoroglu‚Äù ‚Äî was presented on September 28, 2025, in a renewed production.

This initiative is not only about restoring a musical heritage but also about transmitting timeless values of heroism, resilience, and national pride to future generations. The specially crafted costumes preserved both authenticity and artistic depth, enriching the performance.

We see this as a long-term partnership. Working with partners who share the same values is of great importance. While PASHA Bank OJSC, through its CSR agenda, contributes to preserving our national heritage, the Theatre‚Äôs Director, world-renowned tenor Yusif Eyvazov, keeps these values alive through culture and the arts.

I would also like to express my sincere gratitude to Mr. Eyvazov. His dedication to art played a vital role in bringing this initiative to life.

I am confident that this shared mission will yield results not only within our country but also globally. Plans are already in place for the ‚ÄúKoroglu‚Äù opera to be staged internationally, bringing this cultural treasure to worldwide audiences.

Cultural heritage is the foundation of our identity and unity. At PASHA Bank OJSC, we remain committed to supporting and protecting these values for the future.

activityOfUser.occupation: Deputy CEO at PashaPay | Driving Digital Payments & Fintech Innovations in Azerbaijan

text:
Speaking at #FIBA2025 in Tashkent ‚Äî a city rapidly emerging as a regional fintech hub ‚Äî gave me a moment to reflect on our path. 

In just three years, PashaPay helped to shape new payment habits and bringing daily value to millions through our widely used products, m10 and Milli√∂n. It became an essential part of the country‚Äôs first financial and payment ecosystem - Bir Ecosystem - which brought together seemingly separate yet interconnected business models such as banking, e-wallet, terminal network, transport, marketplace and cross-border activities.

The journey of first 3 years was far from easy, but it was incredibly exciting. There were moments of uncertainty, times when it seemed there was no way forward. Yet through consistency, belief, and the strength of our team - both within the company and across the entire ecosystem - we turned the impossible into reality. In just three years, PashaPay achieved what many considered unachievable. In a market long dominated by established giants, we created a product with NPS>60% used daily by millions - a product that transformed customer behavior and introduced new payment tools that people have come to love.

Equally important, the company not only earned user trust but also became financially sustainable - multiplying more than 6X the initial investment and strengthening the financial results of the entire ecosystem.

Looking back, I realize this has been a truly meaningful and joyful journey - full of the right decisions, timely experiments, and bold bets on the right products and people. Of course, there were also mistakes, misunderstandings, and dead ends. But that‚Äôs the other side of success - those who lead the way always stumble the most.

At the heart of this success story are people - those who unite around a shared purpose, take responsibility not just for themselves but for everyone involved, and keep moving forward even when the path ahead is uncertain. People who believe - in the idea, in the team, and in the meaning of what they do.

And perhaps most importantly - this story isn‚Äôt over. It continues - about movement, belief, and people who make the impossible happen.

I'm grateful that PashaPay‚Äôs story was met with such strong interest and support at FIBA2025. Another highlight of the event was the panel on cross-border payments and fintech collaboration across the Turkic states ‚Äî a great conversation with Anvar Isamukhamedov ..., Paynet | Olim Zakirov, UCMG | Murat Kastan, TURKFIN / UPT | Farkhod Makhmudov, Oson ‚Äî skillfully moderated by Aibek Kurenkeev, E-Commerce Association of the Kyrgyz Republic.

Big thanks to the Fintech Association of Uzbekistan Fintech Association for the kind invitation, and to Chairwoman Nargis Dustmatova for her warm welcome and leadership. üôè

text:
Over the past four days, I had the chance to join the Design Thinking Bootcamp organized by Future Lab by PASHA Innovation  facilitated by the brilliant team from the Copenhagen Institute of Interaction Design

What stood out the most for me was one simple but powerful truth: innovation begins with listening to the customer. Too often we rush to build solutions, but the real magic happens when we stop, observe, and truly understand what people need. Only then can we design meaningful products and services.

Throughout the bootcamp we practiced empathy, co-creation, and rapid prototyping. The hands-on team sessions turned insights into tangible ideas and reminded me how collaboration with diverse minds accelerates creativity.

A heartfelt thank you to the FutureLab team for making this experience possible, and to my leader Maxim Evdokimov  encouraging me to take part in this journey. Your support means a lot!

#DesignThinking #Innovation #CustomerExperience #FutureLab

#KapitalBank #Birecosystem 

What‚Äôs the formula for success in banking?

At first glance, it might seem like growing profits and increasing market share. But those are just visible outcomes.

The true foundation? For us, the answer is clear, customer satisfaction. Because it‚Äôs our customers‚Äô satisfaction that guides us toward every other goal. ü§ù

The main purpose of our regular branch visits is to experience service quality firsthand and listen directly to customer feedback. The results of this approach are clearly reflected in our performance for the first nine months of 2025.
Our Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) score reaching 90% is no coincidence, it‚Äôs the result of a team that values time above all. We resolve 87% of requests on the first attempt and respond to complaints within an average of 1.4 business days.

In short, we earn trust through quality and loyalty through trust.
And behind these numbers and recognitions stands one true hero, our team. I sincerely thank every colleague who brings energy, dedication, and excellence to our daily work.

Let‚Äôs keep the same energy and move forward! ‚ö°Ô∏è

#KapitalBank 


We have achieved a major step in the field of accessible banking in our country! ü§ù

From the beginning, our vision for the Bir ecosystem was not just to create a suite of services, but a digital world that provides equal opportunities for everyone. On this journey, we believed that the pinnacle of success is not just technological innovation, but the comfort and satisfaction those innovations bring to our customers' lives. Our mission was to eliminate the barriers each of our users faces in their daily lives.

Today, we are presenting one of the most brilliant examples of this philosophy.

It is with great pride that I announce we have activated the "Sign Language Video Call Service" in the Birbank application's chat section, a first for our country. 

This means that for thousands of our citizens with hearing and speech impairments, banking services are no longer a difficult process requiring a third person's assistance. This signifies equal financial accessibility for all.

As a bank, we are not only realizing a first in the financial sector but are also inviting everyone to implement more projects that will foster a culture of fully inclusive service in our society. üëç 

#KapitalBank

resharedPost.text:
[Infographic] How to avoid double payment üí≥

https://bit.ly/3BgJ1Rd 

One of the most serious problems a payment system can have is to double charge a customer. When a payment system is designed, it is important to guarantee that the payment system executes a payment order exactly-once.

Mathematically, an operation is executed exactly-once if:
1Ô∏è‚É£ It is executed at least once.
2Ô∏è‚É£ At the same time, it is executed at most once.

Here how to implement at least once using retry and at most once using idempotency check:

üëâ Retry
Occasionally, we need to retry a payment transaction due to network errors or timeout. Retry provides the at-least-once guarantee. For example, the client tries to make a $10 payment, but the payment keeps failing due to a poor network connection. Considering the network condition might get better, the client retries the request and this payment finally succeeds at the fourth attempt.

üë®‚Äçüíª Idempotency
From an API standpoint, idempotency means clients can make the same call repeatedly and produce the same result. For communication between clients (web and mobile applications) and servers, an idempotency key is usually a unique value that is generated by clients and expires after a certain period of time. A UUID is commonly used as an idempotency key and it is recommended by many tech companies such as Stripe and PayPal. To perform an idempotent payment request, an idempotency key is added to the HTTP header: <idempotency-key: key_value>. 

By Alex Xu üëè

text:
The 57th annual meeting of Asian Development Bank (ADB) has been officially opened in Tbilisi and will take place from May 2 through May 5, 2024.¬†
With the theme ‚ÄúBridge to the Future‚Äù, the event will serve as a premier platform to address key economic and development issues for the region.
Today, we attended several seminars such as ‚ÄúSustainability in Finance ‚Äì Role of ESG in Capital Markets‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Role of Technology in Fostering Inclusive Finance and Supporting Client Resilience‚Äù. The first seminar discussed the rise of environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG)-themed capital markets as a key mechanism for directing climate finance to sustainable projects, focusing on the development of ESG bond markets in Georgia and other developing countries. The second one explored the evolving impact of new digital technologies on banking services.¬†
In general, there are nearly 70 events covering connectivity, capital market development, climate change, artificial intelligence and green globalisation.¬†
Turxan Salmanov and I on behalf of Kristal Absheron would like to thank David U. and his team for the well-organized forum and for inviting us to such a significant and interesting event. 

#innovation #finance #sustainability #climatechange #esg #ADBAnnualMeeting

text:
With the support of PASHA Holding, school supplies have been provided to over 12,000 children from low-income families.

Continuing its social partnership with the Social Services Agency under the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection of Population of the Republic of Azerbaijan, PASHA Holding has supported children from low-income families by providing them with essential school supplies.

Ahead of the new academic year, the company has distributed school supplies to first-grade students from more than 12,900 families receiving targeted state social assistance in Baku and across the regions. This initiative not only aims to promote equal access to education for children taking their first steps into school life but also to support social well-being and ease the financial burden on vulnerable families. The school bags, uniforms, and other necessary items provided by PASHA Holding‚Äôs CSR team were delivered to the families by staff from the Agency.

This initiative is part of PASHA Holding‚Äôs ongoing series of sustainable social projects, aligned with its commitment to creating value for society and promoting inclusive development.

text:
Leadership ‚Äì The Silent Architecture of Tomorrow

üß≠ True leadership is often silent.
It‚Äôs not about being the loudest voice in the room, or the one with all the answers.
It‚Äôs about empowering others ‚Äî through trust, clarity, and freedom.

üèõÔ∏è This is a form of architecture not built from concrete or steel, but from values, vision, and principles.

üè¢ Companies like Netflix, Microsoft, Adobe, and Spotify show us that when people are trusted and empowered, they grow ‚Äî and so do organizations.

üåç And this isn‚Äôt just a global story. At PASHA Holding and PASHA Life, we witness this every day ‚Äî through the way our Leadership DNA and principles come to life in decisions, collaborations, and initiatives.
Here, leadership isn‚Äôt about control ‚Äî it‚Äôs about enabling. It‚Äôs about offering space for ideas, and combining trust with responsibility.

‚ú® Empowered leadership is no longer a trend ‚Äî it‚Äôs the leadership philosophy of our time.

It was an honor to share these thoughts at the International HR Summit.

üëè Thank you to the brilliant panelists, our insightful moderator Elvira A., and the dedicated organizers Emil HUSEYNOV, Aytan Huseynova for creating such a meaningful platform.

‚ùì Is your leadership architecture building freedom around you ‚Äî or limitations?

PASHA Investments is looking for #FinancialAnalyst who will research, analysis, modelling and material/report development with oversight from senior teammates. 

Interested candidates are invited to send their CV to the email address recruitment@pashainvestments.az with the subject ‚ÄúFinancial Analyst‚Äù. 

Key responsibilities:

¬∑ Collect industry and market data to assist in conducting market research
¬∑ Review and consolidate information from financial statements and business plans to create inputs for financial models and valuation
¬∑ Assist the operational team in preparation of Investment Memorandums¬†
¬∑ Assist in preparation of presentations on potential investments
¬∑ Assist in preparation of Monthly, Quarterly and Annual Fund Reports to be submitted to Supervisory Board

Key skills and experience required:

¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in relevant area, master‚Äôs degree is an advantage

¬∑ 2 years of professional experience in the field

¬∑ Strong financial modelling skills together with a high degree of proficiency in using MS Excel
¬∑ Excellent report writing skills
¬∑ Proficiency in Azerbaijani and English, Russian is an asset

Location: PASHA Investments LLC, Port Baku Towers, Baku, Azerbaijan.
Position type: Full time.
